hero.title: Leaders Hall
introBody: Leadership in Mōchirīī is based around 6 core principles. Each one with their own responsibilities, but all working together to keep the guild organized, fair & enjoyable for everyone.

panel.title: Guild Leadership
body: Leaders may keep a short profile page for themselves for introductions, preferred roles & the best way to reach them if they choose to do so. Keep it in-game & keep it safe. No personal info, please.
panel.note: Members start with their hall leader for most questions. Requests that affect multiple halls move to the vice leader. Matters that shape policy, long-term direction, or unresolved outcomes move to the guild leader.

council.title: The Council
council.description: These are the contact points for support, planning & keeping the guild's community consistent & fair.

leaders.name: Twills
leaders.summary: Oversees vision, culture & long-term direction for Mōchirīī.

leaders.name: Vice Leader
leaders.summary: Keeps operations consistent, coordinates halls & resolves issues that need broader alignment.

leaders.name: Hall Leader
leaders.summary: First contact for member support, event coordination & keeping the hall active & welcoming.

leaders.name: Isawisima
leaders.summary: Protects fairness & tone, helps mediate conflict & keeps standards consistent across halls.

leaders.name: Lotus Warden
leaders.summary: Supports member well-being, guides new arrivals & helps keep morale alive during busy weeks.

leaders.name: Petal Keeper
leaders.summary: Keeps daily community spaces active, welcomes arrivals & helps members find their footing quickly.

responsibilities.title: Responsibilities
responsibilities.description: Members receive clear direction, fair decisions & reliable support. Leadership maintains structure, protects culture & stays present & accountable. Members participate in good faith, communicate responsibly & contribute to the community's shared pace.

items.title: Direction & strategy
items.description: Sets goals, priorities & long-term focus for the guild.

items.title: Ops & coordination
items.description: Organizes events, manages roles & keeps daily systems running smoothly.

items.title: Culture & people
items.description: Maintains standards, resolves conflicts & sustains morale & cohesion.
